certs.description: list SSL certificates for an app

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:add.description:
add an SSL certificate to an app
Note: certificates with PEM encoding are also valid
certs:add.examples:
$ heroku certs:add example.com.crt example.com.key

Certificate Intermediary:
$ heroku certs:add intermediary.crt example.com.crt example.com.key

bypass.name: bypass
bypass.description: bypass the trust chain completion step

domains.name: domains
domains.description: domains to create after certificate upload

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:chain.description: print an ordered & complete chain for a certificate

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:generate.description:
generate a key and a CSR or self-signed certificate
Generate a key and certificate signing request (or self-signed certificate)
for an app. Prompts for information to put in the certificate unless --now
is used, or at least one of the --subject, --owner, --country, --area, or
--city options is specified.

selfsigned.name: selfsigned
selfsigned.description: generate a self-signed certificate instead of a CSR

owner.name: owner
owner.description: name of organization certificate belongs to

country.name: country
country.description: country of owner, as a two-letter ISO country code

area.name: area
area.description: sub-country area (state, province, etc.) of owner

now.name: now
now.description: do not prompt for any owner information

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:info.description: show certificate information for an SSL certificate

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:key.description:
print the correct key for the given certificate
You must pass one single certificate, and one or more keys.
The first key that signs the certificate will be printed back.

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:remove.description: remove an SSL certificate from an app

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:rollback.description: rollback an SSL certificate from an app

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

certs:update.description:
update an SSL certificate on an app
Note: certificates with PEM encoding are also valid
certs:update.examples:
$ heroku certs:update example.com.crt example.com.key

Certificate Intermediary:
$ heroku certs:update intermediary.crt example.com.crt example.com.key

bypass.name: bypass
bypass.description: bypass the trust chain completion step

remote.description: git remote of app to use
